hero.heroText: Hi! My name is Mona Andreeva. I am a frontend developer who creates digital experiences with a passion for detail and currently studies

about.title: Creative developer with an eye for
about.aboutText: I am a passionate frontend developer who is deepening my knowledge in system development with a focus on the .NET ecosystem.
about.aboutText2: I combine creativity with technical expertise to build modern web applications that both look great and perform flawlessly.

fascom.title: Translation management application for FASCOM AB
fascom.description: A degree project developed for Fascom AB. The application was built from scratch with a strong focus on responsive and user-friendly design. I was responsible for the frontend using React and TypeScript and integrated a REST API in collaboration with backend developers. Features include language management, translation keys, filtering, statistics, and support for both light and dark themes.

findtime.title: FindTime – shared calendar application
findtime.description: An API-based shared calendar project where users can manage availability to find common time slots. The project focused on data modeling, API structure, and database management.

chat-csharp.title: Online chat with C# and Socket.IO
chat-csharp.description: A real-time chat application built using C# and Socket.IO.

chat-js.title: Online chat
chat-js.description: A real-time chat application where users can register, log in, and communicate with others. The project includes both client and server with authentication, message handling, and data storage.

webshop.title: Webshop
webshop.description: A web shop with basic e-commerce functionality such as product listings and a shopping cart. Users can manage products, adjust quantities, and see the total cost in real time.

todo.title: To-do list
todo.description: A clean and simple to-do list application where users can add tasks, mark them as completed, and remove them. The focus was on structure, TypeScript, and usability.

contact.title: Let’s build something
contact.contactText: Do you have a project in mind? I’m always open to discussing new opportunities.
